cons: The company has deteriorated in last few years, both as a place to work & from a customer service viewpoint. Too many invented senior management jobs created for very unqualified people. review_title: Amazing organisation, best place I've ever worked!
job_title: Brand and Design Manager in Yeovil, England
pros:
Opportunities to grow and develop - I was empowered to make decisions, I wasn't micro managed but offered support when I needed it. I was encouraged and supported when I had ideas to take forward. It was a role where I was given every opportunity to develop and thrive.
Salary and benefits - the job was well paid and there was a bonus post Christmas despite the difficult economic climate.
Supportive team - great colleagues who support each other some have become great friends.
The CEO - his leadership and vision of what he aimed to create was one of the things that kept me there, motivational and always felt like a privilege to hear him speak.
Agile working - being able to work from home and
cons: I have nothing but positive words for Abri

pros: Fantastic values-led organisation with an excellent benefits package. Strong, forward-thinking leadership team with a real commitment to employee wellbeing.
Frequent reviews, abolity to change jobs internally and good promotion within. Good benefits. Flexible working for non-trade roles. Mental health is important and never scoffed at.
cons: Office parking can be a bit scarce sometimes (if you do need to go in from time to time) colleagues will sometimes book spaces and not use them.
